awd_abstract_narration: Chemistry Departments engaged in front-line research use                        computers with graphics terminals for the dual purposes of                      carrying out rapid calculations and for studying and displaying                 important chemical structures.  This award from the Chemical                    Instrumentation Program will help the Chemistry Department of                   Duke University to acquire a computer system with a graphics                    terminal.  The areas of chemical research that will be enhanced                 by the acquisition include the following:                                                                                                                       1) Ab initio calculations of the NMR chemical shift                             2) Conformational studies of carbohydrates                                      3) Computer simulations of the molecular structure and dynamics                    of liquids and disordered solids                                             4) Chemometric analysis of retention data                                       5) Free radical macrocyclization                                                6) Protonated base pairs and cross-strand mutagenisis
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
